details.title: Former Karnataka CM Yeddyurappa casts his vote
details.content:
Former Karnataka CM BS Yeddyurappa casts his vote at a polling booth in ward no 132 at Shikaripura in Shimoga. Voting for 3 parliamentary constituencies Bellary, Shimoga, Mandya&2 legislative assembly constituencies Jamkhandi, Ramanagaram began at 7 am today. #KarnatakaByElection pic.twitter.com/6SIbyGRZ1q

— ANI (@ANI) November 3, 2018

details.title: BJP invites Divya Spandana to cast her vote after viral tweet on PM Modi's photo
details.content:
Ramya, Congress Social Media head, in midst of controversy over her “bird dropping” tweet against Prime Minister Narendra Modi, has been invited to cast her vote in favour of BJP. 

BJP worker Shivakumar Aradhya has appealed to Ramya to cast her vote in bypolls to be held on Saturday.

(Click here to read more)

details.title: Voters turnout till 9 am
details.content: Parliamentary constituencies Bellary 4.40%, Shimoga 8.61% and Mandya 4.18%. Legislative assembly constituencies Jamkhandi 9% and Ramnagar 8%. (ANI)

details.title: Voters in Haraginadhoni Village boycott elections over drinking water issue
details.content:
#KarnatakaByElection2018
2100 voters stay away from polling stations at Haraginadhoni Village. The villagers had boycotted the elections demanding permanent drinking water facility. DC Ballari and SP Ballari had convinced the villagers to withdraw the protest. @NewIndianXpress

— Ashwini M Sripad (@AshwiniMS_TNIE) November 3, 2018

details.title: Locals queue outside outside a government school to cast their votes
details.content: Voters queue at a booth in government school Hirepadsalgi, jamakandi (Photo| EPS)

details.title: Polling delayed at a Ramanagaram booth
details.content:
#WATCH: A snake being removed from polling booth 179 in Mottedoddi of Ramanagaram. The voting was delayed after it was spotted and resumed soon after it was removed. #KarnatakaByElection2018 pic.twitter.com/W1XrDeIP3z

— ANI (@ANI) November 3, 2018

details.title: 22 percent voters turn out recorded till 11 am
details.content: A total of 22.3% voters turnout at 11 am with a increase of 12.3% compared to first session (7am to 9am) in Jamkhandi assembly by-election. (Photo| EPS)
Voting turnout till 3 pm - Parliamentary constituencies Bellary 47%, Shimoga 41.49% and Mandya 37.7%. Legislative assembly constituencies Jamkhandi 58.82% and Ramnagar 54.76%.
